edu.uw.cirg.truenth.oauth.builder.api

Class TrueNTHOAuthProvider

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.uw.cirg.truenth.oauth.builder.api.TrueNTHOAuthProvider
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.scribe.builder.api.Api

    public class TrueNTHOAuthProvider
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.scribe.builder.api.Api
    OAuth API provider.

    Based on org.scribe.builder.api.Api and DefaultApi20.

    This class has similar goals as DefaultApi20, but the particularities of SS called for a custom implementation that the default APIs would not satisfy.

    Originally, this class was aligned with Scribe's service implementations, but as new requirements for dynamic server configuration emerged, the use of TrueNTHOAuthConfig became imperative.

    Since:
    Sep 11, 2015
    Author:
    Victor de Lima Soares
    See Also:
    TrueNTHOAuthService, TrueNTHOAuthConfig

      • getAuthorizationUrl

        public java.lang.String getAuthorizationUrl(TrueNTHOAuthConfig config)
        Returns the redirection URL where users authenticate.

        This URL will be used to redirect the users to SS, which will authenticate them and redirect them back to the callback URL.

        Parameters:
        config - OAuth configuration.
        Returns:
        The URL where the system should redirect users.

      • getAuthorizationUrl

        public java.lang.String getAuthorizationUrl(TrueNTHOAuthConfig config,
                                            int numberEncodings,
                                            org.scribe.model.ParameterList callbackParameters)
        Returns the redirection URL where users authenticate.

        This URL will be used to redirect the users to SS, which will authenticate them and redirect them back to the callback URL.

        Same as getAuthorizationUrl(config, numberEncodings, callbackParameters, null) .

        Parameters:
        config - OAuth configuration.
        numberEncodings - Number of encoding operations to be applied on the callback URL. Two encoding operations are necessary to communicate properly with SS after browser redirections in POP UPs.
        callbackParameters - Additional parameters to add with the callback URL. This parameter list will be added to the callback URL. Those parameters are destined to the callback target.
        Returns:
        The URL where users will be redirected.
        See Also:
        getAuthorizationUrl(TrueNTHOAuthConfig, int, ParameterList, ParameterList)

      • getAuthorizationUrl

        public java.lang.String getAuthorizationUrl(TrueNTHOAuthConfig config,
                                            int numberEncodings,
                                            org.scribe.model.ParameterList callbackParameters,
                                            org.scribe.model.ParameterList parameters)
        Returns the redirection URL where users authenticate.

        This URL will be used to redirect the users to SS, which will authenticate them and redirect them back to the callback URL.

        Parameters:
        config - OAuth configuration.
        numberEncodings - Number of encoding operations to be applied on the callback URL. Two encoding operations are necessary to communicate properly with SS after browser redirections in POP UPs.
        callbackParameters - Additional parameters to add with the callback URL. This parameter list will be added to the callback URL. Those parameters are destined to the callback target. For instance, TrueNTHOAuthConstants.REDIRECT.
        parameters - Additional parameters to add on the Authorization URL. This parameter list should be used for especial circumstances to fine tune requests directed to the the OAuth server; for instance, SS's "next" parameter: TrueNTHOAuthConstants.NEXT.
        Returns:
        the URL where users will be redirected.
